title: Comparatives
description: Comparatives are used to compare two people, animals, or things. They show differences in quality, size, or amount.

subtopics.title: Short Adjectives
subtopics.description: Add -er to short adjectives to make the comparative form.

examples.explanation: Add -er to adjectives with one syllable

examples.sample: This bag is smaller than that one.
My brother is older than me.

subtopics.title: Adjectives Ending in -y
subtopics.description: Change -y to -i and add -er for adjectives ending in -y.

examples.sample: This test is easier than the last one.

subtopics.title: Long Adjectives
subtopics.description: Use 'more' before adjectives with two or more syllables.

examples.sample: This garden is more beautiful than that one.
The book is more interesting than the movie.

subtopics.title: Comparing Two Things
subtopics.description: Use 'than' after the comparative to show the difference.

examples.sample: My house is bigger than yours.
This test is easier than the last one.
She is taller than her sister.

exercises.instruction: Complete: 'This car is ___ (fast) than that one.'
exercises.sentence: This car is ___ than that one.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using a comparative: 'This book is interesting. That book is boring.'
exercises.sentence: This book is interesting. That book is boring.
exercises.expected: This book is more interesting than that book.
